description.narrative: As a research institution, DERG prioritizes practical policy relevance of its work. Moreover, the Group is presently striving to boost this element by embedding solid practical experience in development assistance and poverty alleviation efforts in Sub-Saharan Africa with its academic work in the above areas of inquiry. For this DERG seeks the contribution of an experienced practitioner with extensive background in foreign aid and poverty alleviation efforts to collaborate with its own researchers and those of participating African universities, especially within the fields of donor-recipient relations and extreme poverty. The objective of the assignment is to: • assist in producing and disseminating policy relevant knowledge about the most current nature and dynamics of extreme poverty in Sub-Saharan Africa as well as key challenges and impediments to poverty alleviation, and • contribute to an in-depth understanding of how donor-recipient relations have evolved over the past 25 years and how they can be improved in the years to come with a view to enhancing aid effectiveness with a particular focus on the alleviation of poverty.
